and I have to say better off going to a restaurant.  The only great taste was the
desserts.  My husband was to going to the bathroom at 2:00 in the morning because
of the food and I was sick to my stomach and didn't get to sleep until 2:00 in the
morning.  HERE IS YOUR WARNING.

I went to this buffet on a Sunday.  The price was too high for what it was.  Crab legs was the main attraction.  They are so small, its not worth working for your food.  
HOWEVER, I must say I thought I was in heaven when i tried the bread pudding that was in a throw away foil cup that sat on a hot table.  I can't describe how delicious this was!  wow!!!!

We have been to this buffet a few times and each time it Gets worse.   No problem in getting seated ordered three waters received two she came back and said she was going to get us another one and never dId.   Took my mother there for Mother's Day the food. Was terrible the turkey was tough prime rib wasn't done I didn't have any eggs after 15 minutes we finally got some eggs because that's the only thing that she could eat.  The selection of food was terrible.   The staff acted like they were being bothered if you asked where the food was. 
The price was ridiculous charge $74 for three people and that was with our card for a discount for a holiday I was expecting to find a little bit better but day but I don't think will be returning to this place even though we live close by I thought the Southpoint was bad but this is worse I need to find somebody to update their menu because half of it tasted like it came out of a box

Tip: Join their player's club and you'll get the buffet for $13.99. I'm weird and one of my favorite meals is steak with salsa and tortillas. Some nice lady carved me big chunks of a roast and I got a handful of flour tortillas, a soup bowl of salsa and went to town. Not the highest quality food, but it was good, and for $13.99 it makes you consider gastric bypass surgery. If I lived in Vegas I think I'd be a much larger person.

The service was fine and the food was ok. But in a city known for food and service, ok doesn't cut it. 

We had to run an errand in the area and decided to grab dinner while we were there. I think we would have been better off saving the money and going back home. 

There was nothing remarkable about the food. I ate some mediocre dishes that seemed to largely come from frozen. Nothing was horrible, but we will not be going back.  On a friday night, there was no prime rib, no seafood, nothing at all special.  And at $17 per person, I really wish I would have taken a few moments to read reviews before we'd gone in.  I could have had a much better dinner for the same dollar hundreds of other places in the city, literally.  And in the future, I will be doing so.

An all time favorite buffet for breakfast, lunch, or dinner for the locals. Sign up for the players card for extra savings. The food there is excellent, with many serving stations.The lines into the buffet can be long, so get there early. This is a great place to go for holidays, or for any occasion to share with family and friends. The staff is always friendly, and you will love the desserts!

It's definitely lacking a lot not the best in vegas but not the worst. Needs to step it up it's not even a 3 star buffet it's really more of a 2 star buffet food is not even close to any of the others

Ate here for dinner the Saturday, Polynesian buffet. It was ok, but nothing mind blowing. Luckily I had a 2 for 1 coupon, so it was worth it for that price. Was looking forward to the suckling pig, but it was just ok. The poke was fresh, but needed more flavor. The Lomi Salmon was very bland! The rest of the food was alright, but nothing you couldn't find somewhere else. I did like the Haupia for desert, though! The service was good and the employees were friendly. My plates were quickly cleared and my drink was always refilled. If you're at the Silverton Casino already, go for it, but I wouldn't drive across town for it.

Took some friends to dinner here last night and afterwards felt ashamed for having brought them here. Couldn't stick a fork into the sweet and sour pork. It was hard as a rock. The BBQ pork was almost the texture of jerky. Really disappointed and yet I don't think the management really cares. Will never come back here for dinner. 
Mondays fifty percent off for seniors is their only saving grace. For five bucks there's always something to pick out among the offerings to make it worth while. Other than that, you're better off finding a place that's worth $15.00 a plate. This ain't it.

My wife and I went on BBQ night. We were surprised to find there was not much BBQ to be found. So.e chicken and maybe some kind of pulled pork. We were not impressed, especially for the price. We will not be returning.

This buffet is never a disappointment. It seems that we always wind up there in the middle of the week and there is almost no line. The food is always tasty and the selection is pretty good. They have a nice desert bar. The price isn't bad at $13.99 with your players card. You can't beat $5 all you can drink beer.

Went to the Polynesian night for dinner! Best decision made for dinner. The selection was really good, food was very delicious. Everything was clean & well kept full & plentiful. Price was great for the selection of food that was available! Ahi poke was the best I have had in along time. Definitely will be back for this one & well be sharing with friends!!!

August 12, 2011

This buffet is amazing!  I would have gave this place a 5 star rating if it weren't for the ridiculously long line and grumpy lady at the dessert counter.  Aside from that.. superb and highly recommended!

Pros:
  +  The best Prime Rib I have ever feasted on
  +  Inviting ambiance with spacious seating
  +  steamed crab w/ the option to toss in flavors

Cons:
  -  Lines are way too long
  
Okay, let me start off with the negative...  I met my girlfriend at Silverton since I was coming from work.  My girlfriend arrived at 4:30pm.  I arrived at near 5:00pm and we didn't get to our table until 6:15pm!  That's ridiculous!  Friday is Seafood day (which is the day we went) and starts at 4pm.  I was starving by the time we got in (good considering I was about to devour AYCE style).  Dinner on Friday Seafood night is $22.99 with your Silverton card.  This is a good price in comparison to the likes of Wynn and the M buffet.  I hated the wait, but was really surprised at the quality of the food.  The service was really good too aside from a grumpy worker in the dessert section.  

Overall:
  I would highly recommend this buffet to people.  This is overall the best buffet I have ever been to.  The quality, price, and service combined makes this an awesome experience.  

Tips:
*  Different days have different specials:
Friday Dinner is Seafood Night
Thursday Dinner is Polynesian Night (Hawaiian)
Tuesday Dinner is Cowboy Night (BBQ) 
(I'm not too sure about Tuesday being Cowboy night.. Call first if you are interested in this one.

*  Try the Prime Rib....AMAZING!

*  The crab laid out is cold crab.  If you want boiled crab, you have to ask for it. 

*  Don't forget to get your crab sauteed in flavor. I got Garlic butter YUM!

*  Save room for dessert: a selection of sugar-free desserts.  I'd recommend the Cappuccino Ice Cream (this one isn't sugar-free).

*  Show up early to avoid the wait in line.  

* Sign up for the Player's card for free buffet at Silverton.  

*  Lunch hours end at 3pm and Dinner starts at 4pm.

This is the first time eating here and it was not bad at all. The Salad was kind of old but it did have variety of dishes with free champagne and some drinks. Sunrise was good as well. Nice upgraded decor as well. Will come back again.

I can't really complain about a $6.99 breakfast buffet that turned into brunch shortly after we were seated ;)

For breakfast they had bacon, sausages, scrambled eggs, biscuits with country gravy, french toast, granola, oatmeal, country fried steak, potatoes Au Gratin, and a "make your own omelet" section. The country gravy was probably the best I've ever had! Not too thick and it was just oozing with flavor. It was so good we even poured it over our omelets. We went back to the buffet for breakfast seconds and that's when we noticed the whole other half of the buffet was now open for the lunch selection. They had an Asian food section with chow mein, orange chicken,broccoli Beef, egg drop soup, wonton soup, and fried rice; An Italian section with pizzas, pastas, and I believe they were opening up a "build your own pasta" section because I read some sign that read: First, choose your own sauce. And the salad bar with a few choices of soup. Since I was already kind of full from my first plate, I just got a bowl of tomato soup, which was very tasty. Don got a giant piece of brisket, which he described as "ok," but within a few minutes the whole piece was nonexistent. Before we left, I checked out the dessert section which included assorted pies/cakes, gelato, gingerbread cookies, and breakfast pastries. I went with the gingerbread man because I was feeling a little festive. I only ate off his head, but it was nice and soft ;)

Tip
*They no longer have the $6.99 holiday buffet since it only ran for about 5 days. THey only have a weekend brunch, but it's $17.99

On Wednesday night my wife and I have now eaten here 3 times and each time it improves. Clean environment, drinks are served quickly, food is above average. It's a big and fun location and the Price is Right! My favorite was the Asian cuisine and mint and chip ice cream!!

This buffet isn't really "bad" but I don't think I'd come here without a promo or comp.  A lot of the food is very greasy and while the serving stations look like there should be a huge variety, a close look shows just a few small pans.

I've been here 3 times and the selection doesn't really change, the dessert station is solid with an assortment of simple items like pie, cookies and ice cream with a few "fancier" cake like items.

I normally ask for 2 glasses of whatever drink I order because I've gotten burned here before with waiting a long time for refills.  That being said, I've had worst, but I doubt I'll come back unless it's a free or reduced price.

Went for brunch for the third time here and it was the best it's ever been. Simply because of their crab legs. I mean, damn. So good. I like the ones you have to break with your hands. It's more fun to me! Yeah you have to work a little bit more, but at least you don't have crab falling out of its shell like aria and cosmos Buffet. The other two times I've been here, the crab sucked. Plain and simple, it was smaller - harder to snap and it tasted terrible. Now it's totally different!

You have 4 options on the crab. Cold, steamed, Cajun sautéed, or Garlic sautéed. Both sautéed were delicious! 
Another part of this buffet that I enjoyed was the Asian section, the chicken dish and beef noodle dish was great. And the pizza was really good.
I think this is one of the best buffets because of the food but how can you beat the price??? $17.99, for free champagne too?!? One of the best buffets for the money in Vegas!

This buffet is located at the Silverton Casino. I have stumbled away food drunk from this Fine Epicurious Gastronomique establishment many a time. If I time it right I hit it on a Saturday which is Polynesian night where I spend a few hours devouring Fred. (Fred is the name I gave to the roasted suckling pig) Although, Old Fred is long gone his name still lives on in memory through is brothers and sisters who graciously offered up themselves (as Fred) every Saturday night for the firm price of $23.80 gratuity not included. 
Besides Old Tasty Fred. This buffet offers up a lot of tasty Polynesian fare that one might miss unless of course you go to Polynesia. Or come here and stand in line for almost 2 hours with mostly Polynesian folks some the size and strength of tanks that could easily kill you with one punch. That being said,  you know the place is worth it.
Some of my personal favorites are the Ahi Poke, Lomi Lomi, Tako Poke, Sushi, Kalbi Beef Ribs, Suckling Pig with Crispy Skin, Kalua Pork Loin, Pork Lau Lau. They also offer up a really nice New York strip steak as well as all the standard buffet stuff you normally find.

Went here for brunch last Saturday.  For a buffet it wasn't bad.  A little pricey but not bad.  The beverage server was on the mark - our cups were never empty of coffee. Unlimited Samosas were included which was great - and I am not a frequent drinker but I did have one Saturday.  Good amount of food to choose from and everything tasted good.  Nothing really to complain about.  Not top notch but worth a revisit.

Well I've been here several times now for the Polynesian night  and I have to say that the food is good for the price. That being said, I only go when I have the two free buffets  promotion (with the Silverton Rewards Club  Card) and with only two people... so yeah, it's really worth it. A lot of items are hit or miss but overall I can't complain and it has actually gotten better each time I go. There usually  isn't much of a wait and the food is always hot and generally fresh.  If you haven't tried it in a while, wait for the promotion and try it again after all free food is better than.. well okay.. it's free food, deal with it.  For the rest of the review, keep in mind that we brought two teens with us that took our price from free to just over $40 before tip. Also, this review is ONLY for the Polynesian night.

Now, for what's good. Their tuna poke seems to occupy a considerable portion of my plate each time. The giant roasted pig freaked the kids out but whatever, they think McDonalds rules the world so they don't count. The roasted pig is very good every time I have it. There was also some salt and pepper pork that seriously made an impression on everyone at the table including the grumpy, texting teens. There were a couple of soups that were really good especially the one over by the sushi that had the clear noodles. I don't remember the name but it looked so nasty that I just had to try it and to my surprise it was actually very good. The Wonton soup was very good as well. The mashed potatoes and bowtie pasta were great. I even had a couple pieces of a spicy tuna roll that didn't offend me as sushi on a buffet can often do.  Also, the peel  and eat shrimp was good but naturally should have been fail proof one would think.  The oysters are usually decent enough except for the fact that they ran out of them by 4:45pm. We arrived at 4:30pm and they open at 4pm and I didn't even get one. Not cool. I stood there and watched as the guy in front of me filled up two plates until there were none left. I was impressed with his lack of consideration for the line of  people behind him and yet jealous at the same time.  The empty space was replaced with clams that had something on them that I wasn't all that impressed with.  The clams were fresh but the topping just ruined it for me, not my thing I guess.

 Some misses were believe it or not the macaroni and cheese. Bad enough to spit out. Same  goes for the macaroni  salad and popcorn shrimp. Just bad. Like take it off the buffet entirely kinda bad. No really. Now for the prime rib. Usually it is pretty good. This last time was different. It was cooked entirely rare and if anyone wanted it cooked differently it was sliced and put on a grill to be cooked to their liking. As I watched cooked slices being handed off to other customers it looked like nothing more than a bad steak. I opted for mine rare as I generally like it. Unfortunately I couldn't even eat that. I felt really bad having to leave an excellent  cut of meat on my plate. It just felt wrong.

Overall, the food (on Polynesian night)was good enough to go back, when it's free (or BOGO), if you don't bring teens, just happen to be in the area and are in general just really hungry enough to not care.
You just need to find what you like and stick with that. Unfortunately this isn't the type of buffet where you walk in and love every single item that they have. I give it three stars only because I know that what is good is really good and that comprises more than half of the buffet. As for the rest of the buffet,  it may be a bit blah but a person can only eat so much anyway. I just go back to the good stuff and that works for me. If I had to pay the regular price of $21.99 I probably wouldn't go. That being said, I have no doubt that I will be returning when my next promotion comes in the mail.
Very delicious food and very affordable. The fresh made fish tacos and the beef brisket are very very good in my opinion. Our server NOEMI was very courteous, friendly and fast. Thank you Noemi.

Clean and nice atmosphere.  The food is good quality.  Much better than the local Station Casino Buffets.  They have pretty decent fried oysters and their seafood is good, which is a big chance at a buffet, but this was good.  Like their dessert options.  Stuff is marked Gluten-Free which is good to know since I don't do gluten.  I would go back.

Both times that I have been here was not by choice. I forgot why I never came here but now I remembered why. This place sucks! A lot of their entrees had too much salt or lacked flavored. Beyond disappointed that nothing hit the spot besides the lau lau which was decent enough. To top it off I didn't even enjoy their desserts. Glad both times I came I did not have to pay as I was treated but even then I did not enjoy the food. Never coming back and our server sucked as well.

Excellent buffet. A different theme every night. Thursday is seafood night. Love it. We've been here about 8 times & have never been disappointed. The deserts are pretty good too. 

Update they don't have Thursday night seafood anymore. Not going to be back until they bring it back. Was very disappointed when we came on Thursday. It's Boring food.
The food was not only tasty and fresh but the service was absolutely  delightful. I have been to a few buffets here in Vegas and this one's value and quality  rivals none...

This buffet has a new chef.  The food here was delicious!  I spoke with the Executive Chef who informed me of the allergens in the food.  He was very helpful. We went today (Thanksgiving) at 2 PM.

NAOMI was our waitress, friendly, timely with drinks & personable.  Where did they find her?  She's a keeper!

I tried the ham, turkey,  prime rib, mash potatoes, yams, & vanilla ice cream. Everything was so good I had seconds on Turkey,  ham,  mash & yams. 

Yup, what a wonderful Thanksgiving. Hot,  fresh food!  Thank you chef & your staff. 

He also told me they had a gluten free menu at Mi Casa. He runs all the restaurants, even the cafe is good now.  Yay!

It depends on what you want in a buffet. If you just want eat a meal and everyone can choose what they want, then it's a good choice especially for seniors on a Monday.  If you want a wide variety then this may not be the right buffet. Also remember the selection really don't change much. 

I had a piece beef with a salad and it was good. Dessert selection looks decent, looks like all store bought.

The service was friendly and prompt. We didn't have to ask for refills.
Gorgeous restaurant, buffet.  The decor and design is breathtaking.  Awesome staff and we had a comped buffet for new player members and achieving 40 points.  Great value.  :)

This place is nice! I love the lodge feeling and they hit it here dead on. There's a really cool water feature in the front, that looks like water is running down logs stacked on each other, only it's made of copper, or at least that's the color. 
 We had a team meeting here. We came during not-so-busy hours and it was really nice. The food was good, and the gelato bar is really cool, but my favorite part is really the feel you get from their interior design. Very comfy, very "lodgy". :)

Please DO NOT come here. The food was not taste good, less selections and some of them are spoiled. Very sloppy and dirty on the counter food items. It's not worth it to pay $10- $16 for lunch or dinner. I just wanted to put the words out there. I felt bad if I didn't write this review. I like to share other people don't waste your money eating here. Go to other casinos buffet have better food and more selection items. I would never dine in here again. I am expressing the truth based on my experience.

whether it is lunch or dinner, seasons buffet is always a good value.  I love getting fish tacos during lunch.  for the price of a 3 fish taco plate at a place like wahoo's, you can enjoy 3 fish tacos plus the rest of the entire buffet for the same price!!!  salad bar has all your typical fix ins.  there is a pasta bar which you can create your own tasty concoction.  there is Italian with pizza and pasta.  the Chinese section has 2 soups and favorites like orange chicken, pot stickers, and Singapore noodles.  there is a carving station that had beef brisket and corned beef.  my mouth is water just thinking about the food.  and this is just lunch!!!

Polynesian buffet is another story.  you've got lau lau, tako poke, ahi poke, chicken long rice, roast pig, haupia, lomi lomi salmon, poi, the list goes on and on.  and for $20 you can't beat the price.  if i am having a craving for Hawaiian, you will find me here on Saturday night!!!

This buffet is one of the brunch buffets I haven't been to, and seeing as how it's close to where I live I figured I'd check it out. While in the car I was reading reviews on here and started second guessing my decision. There were such AWFUL reviews I was nervous but figured since I had a BOGO coupon it would be worth it even if it was meh. 
When we arrived the atmosphere was great, I loved the layout of the place. They have a BELLINI BAR! They offer peach, pomegranate, mango, and raspberry bellinis as well as mimosas! And they're all included in the brunch buffet. I've had build you own bloody bars but choose your own bellinis? I was impressed. 
I held my breath walking up to the food and let out a sigh of relief when I saw that not only was it clean, everything looked fresh. My first plate was stereotypically brunch. I got waffles, an egg frittata, bacon, sausage, and a blintz. The waffles were actually soft unlike any buffet I've been to, usually they're hard as a rock from being under a heat lamp. The bacon was thick and delicious, the egg frittata was good. Overall my first plate impressed me as I was expecting dry, gross food. 
The second plate I loaded with mac and cheese, turkey from the carving station, stuffing, and mashed potatoes which I smothered in gravy. I also got some sort of Mexican soup. The turkey was moist, the gravy perfect, and the mashed potatoes were to die for. I don't know why I was in a thanksgiving food mood but I was, and it was awesome. 
For dessert I got a Boston creme cake and a red velvet cupcake. Both were excellent. I had about five different bellinis. Overall it's the best brunch buffet I've been to in Vegas aside from wicked spoon, which is higher end anyway so you can't really compare the two. 
I have no idea what all the bad reviews were about but DEFINITELY eat brunch here.

Season's Buffet at Silverton is always a great value.  The scenery at this buffet is also worth mentioning.  It has a very pleasant, cozy log cabin feel to it.  I have a few staples that I always go with when I'm at Season's.  I definitely love their Hawaiian poke, peel n eat shrimp and assortment of Chinese food.  Their desserts are usually pretty good.  I like their cheesecake and their cookies when they're soft and chewy..sometimes they aren't.  Also, brunch is always fun with their different flavors of champagne.  We always have pretty good, speedy and courteous service from the staff.
Although we rarely go unless there's special pricing or we've got a promotional deal of some sort, I definitely enjoy it there when we do go.

This was a decent buffet for dinner. The price for dinner was inexpensive unlike other dinner buffets in the Strip. Their sushi and their aki poke is delicious The food is great although there's not that many selections to choose from. A downside of this buffet is their dessert section. Their dessert section was like an HomeTown  buffet dessert section and I was expecting better. I bet their cakes are Betty Crocker. It was also not neat and it was messy. There should also be more ice cream flavors. Anyway, the servers are very nice. The ambience is also nice as well. This buffet needs to improve their dessert selection.

I wanted to try this buffet since it is very close to where I live and I have to say that it's a pretty good buffet.

First, it is easy to access (right by Highway 15) and it is easy to park there. The line at the cashier can unfortunately get very long though. I was there on a Sunday and since they had a BOGO deal the line was very long and it took us over almost an hour to actually pay and then get a table, when there were a lot of free tables available... 

Once in there, service was good and the food decently good as well. This buffet is reasonably priced and you get food that really isn't that bad for a buffet. There is also a rather large selection of food options.

The main problem with this buffet is that they will kick you out after 90 minutes there! So be ready to eat and drink as fast as you can, which can be a problem since the lines at the bar are sometimes pretty long and it can easily take 10 minutes to get one drink. At some point, the bar ran out of clean glasses and I didn't get any drink for over 20 minutes...

To conclude, this is a pretty good buffet option, but be aware that logistical issues due to the way this buffet is managed might ruin your experience...

I went to the regular Seasons Buffet (Wednesday night 4 - 9pm)....and it wasn't bad!! I liked the beef cut, not sure if it was prime rib but it was a huge chunk of beef that they cut into slices for you.... I liked the chinese food okay, and the salad bar was ok.  I liked the meat when it was freshly put out (for example i kinda had an older piece of bbq pork i didn't like, but my husband got a new piece and it was pretty tender).  I liked the shrimp cocktail because they devein the shrimp, and it's easier to take off the shell.  The shrimp tasted pretty fresh! I've had like a boiled or tough kind of shrimp so this was pretty good.  The dessert wasn't too bad. Overall was pretty good considering we got it for free! We gambled there a couple of times, so Silverton sent us some coupons in the mail for $15 worth of free food, so we got free dinner AND gambled and made some money!  Usually I spend all my money and then some, but today we were kinda lucky on the Wheel of Fortune and the Goldfish game, hooray!

My previous go to affordable vegas buffet was Red Rock, but for some reason I've always felt like really super salty or bloated the next day... so far here at Silverton, the food tastes good and not too overly salty, so I am able to enjoy it more!

Not impressed with the buffet.  Food was old even though we arrived as they opened at 4 for dinner.  My husband is very allergic to seafood, and choose a ravioli entree which we thought was cheese, but turned out to be lobster.  Once I tried it I stopped him before he took a bite. Spoke with the chef, and they didn't know what was in the food and the label only said 'chef special'.   Besides the drama this was a huge waste of money.

My husband and I decided to give Seasons a try tonight for Polynesian night. Our server (whose name I didn't catch) was very attentive-our plates were cleaned quickly and our drinks were always full. The sushi selection was pretty sparse, but they were all pretty good. The ahi poke tasted like straight onions. I took two bites and tried to make myself like it, but I just couldn't. The teriyaki beef and meatballs were both delicious, as was the suckling pig. It was super juicy! Oh and the chili mint wings and huli huli chicken were awesome! The wings were sweet but spicy-just the right amount of heat! The dessert selection was vast. The little cups were definitely the best. The red velvet cupcake was pretty dry and the frosting on it was oily. Overall we had a pretty good experience, but it was quite a drive for us from Centennial Hills so it may be a while before we make it back.

Lets Start With The People Their Are Wonderful (From Cashier-Server). They Even Had Made To Order Pasta And A Cutting Station. It Wasn't The Biggest Buffet I've Ever Went To But Were It Lacked In Size It Had In Quality/Taste Of Food. I Will Defiantly Return For Lunch Again Soon.

I try to avoid buffets these days because they're  counterproductive to the shape I am slowly trying to work toward being in. However, when you're in Vegas, you break the rules. I did. Twice.

Located inside Silvertons a few miles from the strip, Seasons offers a wide array of different foods, from Chinese to Mexican to good ol' American favorites. The prices are right, and the service is excellent (everyone except for one of the cashiers - I believe her name was Amelia). 

Overall, great experience though. I would eat at this buffet a third time if we'd stayed a few days longer.

I am DROOOOOOOOOOOOOLING already.
THURSDAY NIGHTS = POLYNESIAN DINNER! Excuse me, as the pidgin commences: You're bound to see yo mada'z bes frenz calabash cuzzin & da entire ohana there on Thursday. Okay, so i exaggerated, but you will see plenty of "local-kine" people there on Polynesian night. The "ahi tartar" (aka poke) is better on Thursdays, a  little more salty than the other days which means IT'S ONO. I had this clam chowder there once that I couldn't get off my brain! I keep going back, but the soup doesn't show up again. darn. But seriously, for a decent price ($21.99/person if i'm not mistaken) AYCE polynesian/island style food is pretty damn good in my opinion.

Friday nights are seafood nights, Saturday nights are steak AND seafood nights, and the food is phenomenal for a decent-sized buffet. I do miss the 2-for-1 deal that they had going in November, but I think you get well worth your money here.

Seasons has your weekend dinners COVERED!

It was a last minute decision to go to this buffet. My best friend and I were looking for a place to stuff our faces and I saw that the price for lunch was super cheap. 
Selection was great, they definitely had a lot of variety. Some of the dishes were great and we really enjoyed the seasoned tilapia and lemon chicken. Our favorite was the Little station that they were serving fish tacos from. I would go to the buffet for the fish tacos alone. Desserts were also amazing, they had cute little dessert shooters. Don't bother with the Rice Krispies. They were very dry and not made with enough marshmallow. The brownie was very good and rice. 
Overall, it's a pretty decent buffet if you're on a budget.
Great place to eat simple and clean always fresh foodexcept Mondays is way to busy to enjoy.... Seems like they bus the gray hair in then got to fight it out inside ......!any other day easy to get

The only reason to eat at this buffet is because you are given a food credit or a free buffet coupon.  It is just ok...but most if not all the food is just out of a can.  Hint...try the pasta bar for fresh watch it be made pasta.  Ask for shrimp as it is behind the counter.  Never pay full price and you will be a happy camper!

Ending up here due to all major casinos on the strip had over 2 hour waits.  

This place tries very hard for a 4 star rating and comes very close.   Here are the issues.  

1.  No crab legs.  Have not had them at this buffet for over 4 years.   Bring them back!  Crab legs are a buffet staple.  

2.  Salty.  Lots of great flavors going on, but many of the dishes are too salty.  

The selection is decent.  Enough for a variety of palates.   The service was great.  Quick to clear plates at your table.  

Overall, this place is more than decent.   It saved our group long waits, so for that I was grateful. I can easily recommend.   Enjoy

I have another buffet to add to the list of "never again." The Seasons Buffet has great curb appeal and decent prices but that's where the good news stops. 
I walk up and down the line three times before I found something that looked edible. ALL of the food was drab and unappealing. I tried food ranging from the shoe leather turkey to the eight year old sweet and sour pork and each trip was worse the the other. Even the deserts were tasteless. I tried the pumpkin pie and the carrot cake. It's a sad day when there is no difference between the two. 
Our waiter came by three times to check on us, each time asking if I would like a refill on my iced tea. I said yes please three times and yet never had it refilled even once. 
This was one of the worst buffets I have ever been to. Don't let this review detour you. Give it a try, but go into it with your level of expectation being pretty low.

This place was awful. The food was subpar. We aren't that hard to please but when the food is low quality and over cooked it's a recipe for disaster. Luckily the omelette station was fresh but everything else was horrible. Save your money and go somewhere else. Even McDonalds breakfast would have been better

Hands down, this is one of the best buffets in Vegas. Forget those high price buffets with the bland food. The food is seasoned just right the desserts are great and they have a good variety. 10 min. max from the strip and well worth it! Inside the Silverton Hotel.

Lots of good choices here at a reasonable (compared to other Vegas venues) price. I was in a party of 5 and all enjoyed the food very much. No complaints. Our server was very attentive and helpful.
Hope to go back here before we leave.
We've been here twice this week & we were so pleased to have so many selections & great desserts. We even took friends there tonight. Great value for $

There is the time for a bountiful buffet for the price of $5 on Mondays & Tuesdays. My Mom and I went to this casino to watch the Mermaid Fish Feeding Show but saw their $5 Seasons Buffet ad as we walked out of the elevator. It sounded a good deal so we lined up for the buffet. With a price like that, naturally who would let that pass? There was a line of people waiting to get in, both locals and tourist. But it's all worth the wait.
Immediate service upon getting seated. Our drink orders were taken and served fast. Generous food on the buffet line-up. Self-service, all-you-can-eat. Seafood (with crawfish, shrimps, crab legs among others), Salad Bar and Desserts (includes my favorite German chocolate cake. It was rich and creamy and loved the mint ice cream with my preferred toppings of nuts, chocolate fudge, butterscotch cream, sprinkles, M&Ms), Italian, Meat Carving Station, Grilled Vegetabes, Asian, Mexican, Soups, Fresh Fruit, and American cuisine. Hush puppies, Pecan Pie and Prime Rib were excellent. Food is tasty through all the bites. Ever-hospitable servers and buffet station servers were attentive. "Live Action" Chefs cook food fresh. Food servers dressed in brown country-style outfits with boots. Booths and table seatings abound in this large dining room. Decor is very pleasing for a hotel that's somewhat new. We go to this buffet at least twice a month.

Mondays are also Seniors All-Day Buffet Day at this Seasons "Live Action" Buffet at Silverton Lodge Casino at 11am-8pm for $5. Seafood Buffet on Dinner Fridays for $22.99 and Polynesian Buffet on Thursdays for $20.99. Visit website for hours http://www.silvertoncasino.com/html/las-vegas-top-ten-buffet.asp

Came here for Warren P.'s All-Star Lechon UYE and feast on some "Hawaiian inspired" grindz.....The lechon itself was okay...

One of the cooks sliced me of a big honkin' piece of crispy skin, and I saw that no one was touching the pig's feet, so I asked for the ENTIRE front leg/foot :) the top half was very meaty and tasted more like Chinese-style roast pork, but from the kneecap down, it was totally inedible, just bone and tough skin. The ahi and tako poke were good, as was the lomi salmon and the 3 bowls of poi I had.

Dessert was kinda sad...no haupia, and slim pickin' on the rest of the sweets. The company was better than the food.Guess I'll stick to Island Flavor next time I'm in the mood for some Hawaiian grindz....ALOHA!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(12/365) "Here, piggy piggy!!!"

Love the BOGO buffet offered to player card members, butttttt can they possibly find away to get people inside & seated faster than a snails race!!???? "They" know it's going to be extra busy during their BOGO days so why not prepare and speed it up!! Waiting in a 45 minute line of around maybe 20 people isn't worth it.
Food was pretty good but it's really small so not much of a selection. Staff was friendly and polite but overall an average experience.

We stopped over to the Silverton Casino to see the mermaid in the aquarium.  We got a player's club card and got $5 free slot play and a free buffet.  We had the Saturday brunch which came complete with champagne.  

There were all types of breakfast and lunch items.  The typical eggs, bacon, biscuit and gravy, waffles, french toast.  There were crab legs, a carvery with lamb, prime rib, turkey and stuffing, chinese food, italian food, mexican food, sushi, fruit, and desserts up the wazzoo!

Most of the items tasted fresh and we enjoyed tasting everything.  The regular price for brunch is $18, and on Saturday goes up to $21 for steak and seafood buffet for dinner.  

I know they also offer a buy one get one free buffet certain times of the day, so check ahead so you don't have to pay full price.

I would give this buffet 4.5 stars if I could.  Since I'm nice (and it was better than the Spice Market buffet I gave 4 stars too), I'm going to give it 5.  Impressive buffet for the price.  We went after hiking in Red Rock on Saturday morning and arrived hungry only to find that the Silverton buffet was offering brunch and was a little more expensive than anticipated.  Still, it being Vegas we decided to splurge and were not disappointed.  The buffet included an excellent prime rib, crab legs, cedar smoked salmon, osso bucco (oh so yummy) and a variety of shellfish (plus more, much more).  Some other standouts were the granola french toast, biscuits and gravy and of course the usual assortment of desserts.  For about the price of a lunch buffet on the strip, you get all this?  Very worth taking the trek to the Silverton.  

Plus, we hadn't been to Las Vegas in several years and boy what a difference those years made!  The Silverton has all growed up! Our little boy loved the outdoor world and what has to be the biggest fish tank outside of an aquarium we have ever seen.

Came for New Year's day brunch. I guess for the holidays they don't have a separate breakfast and lunch schedule, instead they have brunch. Overall, the food was not good. The food selection was limited and tasted bland. For 21.99 per adult, I expected something decent. Sorry to say it but this buffet sucked. However, they did serve unlimited champagne tasting and we were lucky enough to get an attentive  and enthusiatic waitress, making our dining experience a little better.

Father's Day 2014

Hubby and I had free buffet coupons so we ended up paying for the kids (12-year-old is considered adult and a 5-year-old), about $29, divided by four = $7/person. 

It was Sunday Brunch and the selection was decent. I enjoyed the small portion chicken fried steaks with biscuits and gravy. Salad selection was okay, only iceberg and romaine lettuces. Sushi selection was minimal each time I went back. Maybe my first time at a buffet and not eating sushi :(

I was impressed they had a Mimosa/Champagne Bar with at least seven choices. I didn't bother to ask if it was complimentary or if you had to pay. 

The cream puffs were yummy and went well with O's chocolate ice cream--I added some to my filling! Yum! ;p

Good food for a decent price, considering we're not much of buffet eaters.

HATE Nothing.

DISLIKE The rubbery quiche. Eggs benedict was hard-boiled not poached. Very limited options within each "international" station.

LIKE Choices of protein entrees (turkey, prime rib, lamb, salmon). Dessert. Steamed crabs. Friendly station attendants/cooks. Classier buffet atmosphere.

LOVE Unlimited champagne/bellinis/wine.

Saturday night there was 8 of us who came to the Hawaiian Buffet.  4 of them were going to Hawaii and we wanted to let them taste some of the food like the poi, the laulau, the poke and the delicious haupia.  This is to name a few.  They were adventurous and tried the poi and poke.  They have an understanding of what the food is and to know which ones they don't want to eat.  This place is great for us Islanders who miss the good food of home.  Looking forward of coming back soon. Aloha

What can I say $5.00 to eat lunch.  Service was very slow to get in and to get the soft drinks.  They looked very understaffed to me. This is a very local place not for the Las Vegas vacation type.  It serves the locals well and does let kids eat here.  So there is a great bargin if you have children. I don't think this Buffet is close enough to the strip or downtown to make a special run here.  They are as my rating states A-OK
Food and service was good.  They have a variety of food and variety of desserts that you want to try all! The bacon and ice cream stood out in flavors, I know random, but it stood out! Lol

We went on a Wednesday night. It was very good. I had a salad, prime rib, pulled pork, Mac n cheese, watermelon, & pizza. They had Asian inspired flavoring on some green beans which was awesome! 
Our booth was old sand had saggy cushions & I felt like I was sinking. That's kind of annoyed me a little throughout the meal. A server told us there was no steak knives & a different server found us some, that was some what bother some. All in all I liked the food selections & it tasted good.

3 stars because 1 star would not be fair since I didn't actually eat the food there. My family went to Bass Pro and then to the buffet on a Sunday around lunchtime. The cashier told me that it would be ADULT price for a 7-year-old. Excuse me? Since when is a 7-year-old the same price as a full-grown man? Do 7-year-olds eat the same amount of food as an adult?! At most places ages 12+ is the adult price. No thanks, I'm not paying $20 for my child to eat a dinner roll, fruit, and a dessert since I'm sure that is all he would eat there anyway. You obviously do not want families to eat there if you charge that much for a small child. Our large party took our business elsewhere. We went to the Mexican restaurant in the casino and they were very friendly and had lunch specials. Half the price and lots of food.

It's ok better than other places but some of the entreés was a little bland and could use a bit more flavor. Other than that it's pretty good. can't think of another Polynesian buffet but the palms which they no longer offer.

This review is based on their Polynesian Luau Buffet every Saturday evening. My family and I have been homesick and was looking for a place to enjoy a Hawaiian style dinner. We have been reccomended by fellow 9th islanders and my parents stumbled across an Ad inside Las Vegas edition of Kama'aina magazine and with the help of Yelp we decided to give this place a go. We haven't been to Silverton in years so we were bit surprised to see the upgrade throughout the property.

Once we arrived at 5pm, there was a long line with the familar Pidgin accent that was spoken among the many customers in line. The Aloha spirit was present including the many Ohanas(families) that filled up the Buffet. It took approximately 30min. when we finally got seated inside plus it didn't help that they we came across alot of Uncles and Aunties, Lol. 

The food items that were present was abundant in selection and typical to what you would find in Hawaii. FYI, Hawaiian food is influence by 5 cultures that includes China, Japan, Philippines, Korea and Portugal. This unique blend of cuisine is known locally among Hawaiians as, "local food."

The items that we had were,
-Roasted Pork w/ the head of the pig.
-Ahi Poke
-Tako Poke
-Lomilomi Salmon
-Pork Laulau
-Teriyaki Beef
-Seaweed Salad
-Cucumber Salad
-Kimchi
-Poi
 and various items.

Everything was fresh and delicious with a few items that could use a little improvement. The Teriyaki Beef was a bit dry and the Ahi Poke was a bit salty but consistent with flavor. I personally like the Pork Laulau, which is pork meat that is wrapped up in Taro leaves and steamed. The staff was pleasant and the atmosphere felt like we were back home! It would've been nice if they had a Hula, Polynesian and Tahitian Dancers to set the mood, Lol. Even having island style music play in the background would've been nice to have. Then again I could wait for the Pure Aloha Festival for the Entertainment. Overall, I would personally come back and take family and friends to check this Buffet out.

2017 Yelp Review #16

Decent Buffet for the price. I've been here a couple times for lunch and dinner. The variety is nice and the dessert section is great. I loved that they had pozole and bbq ribs. Once in a while they will have some deals like half off or by one get one free. The decor is really nice, newer spot and since its way off the strip not that busy. The service is good too, quick for refills and additional napkins. If you're in Vegas and have a rental, come out here, you will like it. The Silver ton itself is pretty and is right next door to the Bass Pro shop.

Dear Director of Food and Beverage,
 I wanted to write you to let you know we had the most amazing time at your Buffet. The food was good but the service was Excellent! Our server, Annette, ran circles around the other waitress. We never had an empty glass nor was there ever a dirty plate on our table. I will be back and I hope to have her as my server again!!
Yuck....would have been really upset had I paid for this. It's like cafeteria food. I love the resort and casino, but this buffet is not good.

Louise - Racist cashier at seasons buffet- discriminates against non-white paying customers. This was done in front of their black-jacket wearing supervisors who did nothing to correct her actions. They claim to serve Polynesian Buffet but discriminate against us! Do NOT eat there. Food is terrible anyway. Amber their server cutting the meat is sick today. Coughing and sneezing on the food. Again, management leaves her on the line.

Do not go there!
One of the better locals Buffets.  Too bad the line is always so long.  The deserts used to be better but the rest of the food is still good.  You won't go wrong eating here.

Don't do it! This place sucks during brunch/lunch hours. Not that many selections and when I mean not that many selections...it's very little selections. I hated it. Of course my kids are simple...pizza and spaghetti. I'm very disappointed. I will not be back, I would be better off at the New Orleans buffet. Same price better selections and more!

Always make it a point to hit this buffet up when we are in town. The service is excellent and the atmosphere is good. While it isn't a "mega" buffet, the selection is the right amount and prepared wonderfully. Usually can get a good deal if you have gambled a little in the casino first.

This Place is Worth the 21.99. They can take my money anytime! They have they huge lechon, peppered pork, the pork wrapped in banana leaves was amazing! The chili wings were delicious.  The prime rib was medium rare, talk about yum! Everything was perfectly seasoned. The desserts are amazing. Try the Spumoni! This place has a huge Asian selection and they have an Italian station. The line gets long but that's most buffets in Vegas. I like that the casino doesn't smell like an ashtray. They really keep this place clean.

We came here for lunch since we received free lunch with our membership.  Unexpectedly good and a very good price ($10 for lunch but we didn't pay).  Don't expect spectacular and you'll be alright.  The clam chowder was delicious as was the brisket.  Same with the mac n' cheese and mashed potatoes.  I wish their Asian selection was a little better but that's about my only complaint.  They have a good variety of desserts too and I had several that were very good.  I definitely will come back here again.

Came here on a Saturday night. Everything was fresh and delicious. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Plenty of types of food to choose from. Didn't have to fight the crowds like you would on the strip.

I've been to Seasons several times and it's OK.  They generally have something that grabs my attention and there's something that wants me to take away a star.  When we ate here Sunday, that stayed as usual.  

The grilled vegetables were very good.  I always like their roasted garlic pieces, but this night, the roast beef was cooked until the cow could walk no more.  It was deep, deep brown.  Overcooked completely!

The spicy tofu in the Asian section was very good and the deserts rounded out the evening on the plus side.  I had some peach ice cream and a piece of carrot cake.  A nice way to end a meal.

The service was very good.  There weren't very many people in the restaurant Sunday night so the servers were stretched to the limit.  I'll come back here and I'll find something quite good again and something that I avoid or isn't quite as good.  The place has lost some of the luster it had when it first opened.

The below review represents only the opinion of the reviewer and may not be factually accurate. You should try it, and decide for yourself. 


No. No. No. No. I don't think so my friendly friends. 

They messed up with me and there is no going back to the time when I held the Buffet at the Silverton in high regard. 

Here you go: 

Waffles not good. 
No butter or whipped cream or fresh strawberry to go on waffles. 
Only cheap nasty strawberry giz goo stuff. 
French toast was some weird deep fried crap with oatmeal on the outside. 

The fruit spread was just 2 bowls. One watermelon and one other melon cut into crude chunks is a $20 brunch... there should be beautifully sliced fruit... not disgusting hunks of fruit put in a bowl.) 
The orange juice had a bizarre Tang like flavor to it. 
We got up for 3 minutes after having only been there for 15 and when we came back they had cleared our table. How nice. 

While the manager was a super nice lady the guy serving was below par. He was having a hard time doing the damn thing. 

There has got to be much better out there. Take a drive over to the Red Rock casino... they have a great breakfast.

This is my favorite buffet in Vegas so far! I've been to the one at the Flamingo, Aladdin, The Orleans, etc. But this is the best one so far. It's super clean and there's so many different foods to choose from. They have american, asian, mexican, italian, etc. And they have great desserts to choose from. The few times that I've been here, it hasn't been crowded either. I can't wait to come back to this place!
Very good,  with a terrific assortment.  Get the players card if you don't already have one. The discounts very but it's worth something toward a  better priced  buffet.

First off....

Show up early... THERE CAN BE A HUGE LINE!!!!  and during specific hours... 
you can be waiting for awhile!!!!

It is pretty big and there are alot of sitting booths.

After that, you have a huge selection of food to choose from... I think I ate alot of 
salad and chicken, shrimp and desserts... 

the staff i had were very friendly and took away our dirty dishes.

Price is moderate for a full on buffet.

Solid 4 stars!  Although I'm a tad biased because we only visited on Saturday night for their Polynesian Luau dinner.  What can I say?  I'm from Hawaii!  We like a good luau!!

We visited the Seasons Buffet TWICE in a one month period for their Polynesian Luau.  First time was because got a coupon from a Hawaiian magazine that offered a 2 for the price of 1.  Second time was because the brother in-law was in town.  I handily admit...the 1st visit with the one FREE buffet was soooo much sweeter!  Mainly because it was cheaper.  I delve in cheap.  Except with health insurance, you can never be too cheap.

Of course, for a Saturday night the buffet was busy!  Line wasn't too bad though, maybe a 15 minute wait.  And lots of Hawaiians!  Can't be all that bad then, right?!  Go where the locals go!

OK - this being a specialty night with their Polynesian Luau, I stayed away from the other 'American' food for the most part to focus on the island eats!  All Hawaiian food for me, baby!  And I gotta tell you...I enjoyed all of it!  It was really almost like being at home on Maui...except the lack of a proper BEACH!  

Food was ONO-licious!!  That means 'yummy' to some of you!  I get it, may not be the top in quality when compared to an actual luau in Hawaii but the effort is totally there!  The local Hawaii food we're used to was all there:

-FULL roasted suckling pig!
-Pork Lau Lau!
-Ahi poke!
-Lomi Lomi Salmon!
-Teriyaki beef!
-POI!
-Even Haupia!

I think I ate like King Kamehameha!  Multiple servings of everything!  I understand some of y'all think this kind of food is well...gross...but for a local boy this is a taste of home!  I definitely stuffed by belly full!  Quality of food was great too even with some minor missteps.  Roasted pig was good but wish the skin was crispier.  Ahi poke was good but should have had less onions.  Same thing for the Lomi Lomi Salmon.  Teriyaki beef was good but sauce shouldn't be runny, beef should be MARINATED in the sauce - not sauce poured on afterwards.  Poi was surprisingly pretty fresh, not sour!  Haupia was made like back home, perfect!

I'm not gonna complain about the price either for Seasons Buffet Polynesian Luau, cheaper than a luau back home!  With the Silverton player's club card, only $19.99 a person!  Totally good value for all you're getting!  And don't forget, you still get access to all the other buffet eats like prime rib!  Pizza!  Sushi!  Absolute food fest.

Had an excellent time at the Polynesian Luau at Seasons Buffet, we'll be back again for sure!

CHEEEEE HOOOOOOOOO!!!!!
As with all buffets in Vegas, it is just average.  Decent food for a decent price.  Especially if you have a coupon.

We are victims of good yelp review of this buffet. 
Like many of you guys, we check yelp before we visit the place. 

It's Saturday brunch. This is by far the worst casino buffet we've been to. Fried food is dry and hard enough to be a weapon. If there is food fight in this buffet, people will seriously get hurt. I got chicken fry steak. Took a bite, feel like I was biting into a hockey pot. Shrimp popcorn, hard and chewy. 

Sushi display is something I've never seen before. Usually sushi station is clean and organized. But not this one, sushi is piled up on top of each other, rice got stick to each other, filling is falling out. It looks like a one big plate of sushi fry rice. 

Every single station we saw was messy and not clean. We never seen a buffet this messy and not organized. As we watched the employees who prepared the food behind the station, we realized why. 

Unlike most buffet, most buffet when food it out, they pick up the tray, clean the area, put in fresh tray of fresh food. But not this buffet, the employees put food on top of old ones, they don't even bother pick up the old tray, they simple scoop the new food and slap into the old tray. As a result, food is getting more salty, hardened, messier....

we don't know how's the new chef and what the "good yelp review " were talking about. Don't believe those. They are NOT TRUE.

The normal, inexpensive, weeknight buffet looked sloppy so we almost decided to eat elsewhere, but ended up trying it anyway.  Much to our surprise, the food was seasoned well and tasted wonderful!  When we mentioned this to the manager, she said she would "tell the chef".  If you can get past its appearance to try the food, we recommend this buffet. You can always arrange the food on your plate so it looks good!

I went and ate there with my family! For Fathers day brunch, it was the best... Yummy fried oyster, crab legs you can have your crab legs cold or hot dip in boiling Cajun spice or garlic butter... It was gooood, champagne are served with our choice of syrup ( passion fruit, mango, raspberry, mimosa or Just plain). Chinese, Italian, American and even the dessert was great.. Great price and worthed.  Loved it

We haven't been disappointed yet. Varied menu. Desserts are better than most Casino Buffets.
I was satisfied for low carb items. The grilled veggies are alright. The oil that is used to grill them, always has a rancied taste for some reason.
The cashiers, hosts, and dining room staff are almost always courteous, friendly, and attentive. 
Out of ten visits, we had one server give us an attitude when we asked if we could order beverages while half way done with our plate.
We will go back. The prices are a good deal.

Beautiful decor, excellent service, great food variety and decent quality. This is my go-to buffet when I visit Las Vegas. The mac and cheese, fried rice, pizza, grilled salmon, cake and cookies were all delicious. The fried fish and shrimp however were bland. I used a buy one get one free buffet coupon provided by Grandview Las Vegas and that saved me and my husband about 20 dollars on Friday. Beware! They don't accept the coupon directly at the buffet. You have to go to the player's club, get a player's card and then they apply the coupon to your account. Next you go to a promotion kiosk and print out their version of the same coupon which you take to the buffet. We were not informed of this beforehand and had to make 2 trips back and forth from the buffet to the player's club due to the misunderstanding. Not cool.

Worst buffet ever. And I waited in line for it... 

The veggie pizza wasn't cooked all the way so was doughy and disgusting. 
The clams had a disgusting stringy thing in it so I didn't eat any more (looked like hair). 
The only edible items were the mashed potatoes (can't mess those up) and salad bar. 

How do you have bad service at a buffet? Seasons manages it! The person who led us to our dirty table was a fat balding woman who didn't greet us, instead jutted her fat arm into the air half way across the restaurant for us to follow. 

One of the waitresses spilled water all over a customer. 

I only paid $10 for 2 buffets and it still gets 1 star.

So let me start off with a basic fact about me...I am NOT a buffet person!  I will NEVER, EVER  suggest we go to a buffet.  I only go when I am outnumbered or when family is visiting. So take this review as you may.  

I went here for the first time this week since I had family staying at the Silverton.  I have eaten at many of the restaurants there and have always been happy, so I was aware of the food quality level and just went with it.  

It started off with us in a short line to pay and be seated.  Even though it was a really short line, it took over 25 minutes to get a table.  I'm not sure why, because there were a lot of open tables that I could see and they seemed to be adequately staffed, so I am not sure where the disconnect was.  So that just put me in a bad mood because I was pretty hungry.  Just a warning for y'all, when I get hungry, throw a cracker or something at me because I turn into that girl from the Exorcist when I am starving.  YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

Next up, the food.  I was actually surprised how many sections they had available.  There was a soup and salad bar, pasta bar, pizza, American comfort food, Chinese, Mexican, roasted/grilled meats, and a dessert bar that included freshly made ice cream.  It wasn't a huge buffet, but i found plenty of items that looked and tasted pretty good.  No, it wasn't as big as the World Buffet at the Rio or fancy like the Wynn, but it was ok for what it was.  So yay for that surprise!

The service across the board was hit or miss.  Our table server was very nice and on her game.  She did great.  The hostesses were all a bit grumpy.  Some of the chefs behind the food counters were not happy to be there, but the chef at the meat craving station was just adorable.  The chef in the dessert section was happy.  So it was a little all over the place.

So Seasons is an average buffet for Vegas quality.  If you are a buffet person and in the area, it is an ok place.

Had better buffets! Luckily this was free! My friend got a coupon in the mail and he invited me to come, my guess it is Hawaiian nite, being that there were many Hawaiian dishes, food was just okay but the most worrisome thing was that there are no dedicated serving utensils for each dish, and you have to use the same utensil for serving multiple items, I have a allergy to shrimp, and at the pasta area, the lady used the same spoon to ladle each ingredient, they have shrimp and clams to make pasta and the same spoon was used for garlic, cheese, onions etc , I told her I had allergies and she said it was fine, and continued making my dish, after 1 taste my mouth became itchy and irratated! My allergy is not as bad as some people's , so I have to wonder how many people they have injured or made sick due to this lack of basic food safety techniques??? If u have any allergies I would highly recommend staying away from here! Such a shame, you can tell they spent alot of money on decor ,because it is very nicely decorated but , I think they should have spent the money teaching their employees basic food safety !! Well I'm off to get some , benedryll!! Be warned!!
Just sent one coupon for two people. Corporate getting cheap. Specially nights are expensive.

Came here twice, everything was nasty. orange juice tasted like fake medicine flavor, ordered coffee, and it came in a big mug with lipstick marks and coffee stains on it, rice crispy smelled and tasted like smoky BBQ flavor, Ice cream tasted like medicine. never again.
Decent Buffett. Nothing spectacular. Very clean and well stocked fresh food. Reasonable for the price.

We ate here on Christmas $25.99 a little pricey but they served lamb they fell off the bone. That alone was worth it. Annette our server was so sweet and very attentive! Her service alone was enough for us to come back the next day.

This buffet is definitely not the best buffet in vegas. For $17 pp I expected better. The choices were not that great. Even the salad bar was not up to par. The prime rib and mash potatoes were the only thing good they had going for them. The build your own pasta bar didn't even have all options available. Save some money and try another buffet. The Rio buffet is a better option, however it is more costly.

Nothing really special about this place, it's a small buffet and the buffet is $20+ per person. Aside from that, they didn't let my 8-yr-old get a discount, they charged her as an adult (and my daughter doesnt even eat a lot, shes good with just eating a plate of soup and rice. I literally paid $20+ for soup and rice, where's the justice in that???). The server forgot to refill my husband's drink and we had to call her TWICE for it. Food was ok, it wasnt really that great, they had a few selection. Although their BBQ beef ribs are great. The others just had too much salt, i guess. And im not the type of person who likes salt in food. Not coming back here again, theres a lot of good buffet places here in Vegas that are definitely better and not as overpriced.

go if you have a 2-4-1 or 50% off coupon $11.  went on luau day today. and it was just.."meh."  

After only 45 mins after opening, they ran out of the good sashimi (eel, tuna, shrimp, salmon) and just had "ok" rolls and a whitefish, not sure what it was.   The pickled ginger was the peak of the sushi menu - chilled, and plenty of it.  (Sarcam if you can't read it..)   

So, then I tried the pork.  The crispy skin (best part) was all gone, but the pork was tender. 

The poi (gotta ask for it) - and yes I asked for some - was a bit sweet for me.  

Lessee...the favorite luau food was the chili-lime chicken, because it was crispy!  The huli-huli chicken was ok, but a bit dry, so make sure you get plenty of sauce on the bottom of the pan.  

I passed on the prime rib- was overdone when I saw it two times.  Then the third pass on the way to the dessert bar, I looked good, but I was full.  the chocolate cake with mint ice cream was good -but average.  No gelato.  I looked for some fresh cut fruit, but it was canned, so passed on it.  

In conclusion: next time, and only with the $11 price tag, I'll try the beef, lau lau (hidden away), som-moah chili lime chicken wings, and eat the non-sushi items.  

Peel and eat shrimp is available, plenty of good choices with dessert and non-sugar added options, but try it once, and try something else.   

50+ members have 1/2 off mondays with players club card.

Located in the Silverton Lodge Casino, this is one of the best buffets in town. I recommend the specialty nights Cowboy BBQ, and Polynesian Night, neither are particularly authentic, but hey this is a buffet, leave your food snobbery at the door. The food here is always fresh and the prices reasonable. The great thing about buffets is that if you are traveling with a bunch of people there is something at a buffet to please everyone. If you find yourself at the Silverton give the buffet a try. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

The buffet line is ridiculous. There is no separate handicap line. Twice while walking around the staff bumped into me, normally would not bother me so much but I am 6.5 months pregnant. Both times, neither one of the staff bothered to say sorry or excuse me. The person clearing our tabled kept reaching directly over my face to clear the plates and almost spilled food on me, plus he kept getting our drinks wrong. the food is not very good. I barely ate what I had on my plate. 

They wouldn't have gotten 1 star from me.

There's a variety of dishes to choose from but it's not as large as many of the high end places on the strip.  However, the quality of food is pretty good and the prices are really reasonable. Off the top of my head I recall, there were Asian, American, Italian, and Seafood sections, a small variety of salads and soups, a carving station with Turkey & Prime Rib, an area with some grilled veggies and large kielbasas, many different kinds of pizza to choose from and a good assortment of desserts. They also have a pasta station where they help create a fresh batch to your liking. I've gone here about 3 times now for lunch and it's roughly the same.  It's a great last stop before you drive out of town (lunch M-F is only $9 with Silverton casino card!).

Good buffet food at a very affordable price.

Tip: Get a Silverton Lodge Casino Discovery Club card.  It's free and helps you accumulate points for comps while you gamble. You'll also get a large coupon book which has a couple 2-for-1 's for the Seasons Buffet.  Also, if you are eating by yourself, you can also use the 2-for-1 coupon to just get 50% off instead! However, if you don't have a coupon you'll still get a discounted price for the buffet if you have the card.  It's worth getting!

Hubby and I had some out of town guests and they wanted a "Chinese buffet", this was the closest buffet to where they were parked. 

We, being from Vegas, were not impressed for a Sunday night buffet. The buffet itself is very small in comparison to many others. The food was not terrible, but I wouldn't give it rave reviews either. Hubby tried the Ahi Poke, took one bite and didn't eat the rest, I could tell my looking at the barely pink ahi it was not fresh and tried to warn him (he thought maybe they put a 'sauce' on it that made it that color, he tried it anyway. Not good, not sauce, just not fresh. They had Round Sirloin that my hubby thoroughly enjoyed, I felt it was over cooked and very dry, luckily they offered au jus and horseradish. The au jus had bay leaves floating it, I felt that was weird considering it looked like it came from a package, and had very little flavor, I think they added too much water to the package. I had a salad I made myself, of course, its a buffet, but the eggs (I believe it was the eggs), tasted like soap. I tried each bit of my salad separately, thinking maybe it was the plate, or my fork, but only when I grabbed some egg did I get the soapy flavor. It was weird, and I didn't finish the salad that was left due to it having egg. I tried the pizole, I have nothing to compare that to since it was my first time every having it. It was good, there was a nice hunk of meat in it and it had a flavor that I enjoyed. I tried their spring roll, w/sweet sour sauce, the spring roll was good, but the sauce was way to sugary for my liking, and not enough sour. For desert I had lemon meringue pie and carrot cake. The lemon meringue was good, and the carrot cake was good once I cut the hard sides off it (they need to take note and put paper on the sides to avoid this like other buffets do), but the frosting was to die for! 

All in all, we will be back, we definitely want to try to Polynesian night. Hubby is polynesian and this is a must, especially with all the wonderful reviews of it. I will update then.

Like the rest of the Silverton, this buffet offers good quality and very good value.  I found all ingredients very fresh and great tasting on my 3 visits this trip.  Service was prompt and very friendly.  Adequate choices for vegetarians is a nice bonus too.

Came here on polynisian night cause we all got the free buffet via Reward card (otherwise it would have been $21.99). Spacious and not overly crowded.

Excellent - Kalula pig and kalbi Beef (so tender, juicy and delish!), Cheese Ravoli

Good - Chicken Noodle Soup,

Ok - Poki, Tomato Bisque, Japanese Salad, Mint Chicken wings

Meh - Dumpling soup - the dumplings were too doughy and not much filling.

Icky -Flower Egg Drop Soup, Luau pig was too dry and the skin was NOT edible.

I would rate them 3.5 but decided to round up since the last couple visits were positive. Inexpensive for lunch and decent selection. Good salad bar, tasty brisket and good vegetables. Lots to try and most of it good. Overly generous ice cream server (is that good or bad?) Wait staff very good, with the grand kids and they are free.

After a whole slew of problems getting a  hold of someone at Silverton who would book my reservation for my rehearsal night dinner for my wedding at the buffet, I finally did actually book the reservation. I even gave my credit card number to hold the reservation as the guest list for my party was 25 people.

We arrive at Seasons on the night of my rehearsal dinner and the incompetent girls at the register know nothing of my reservation. In fact, they point out to me, "We don't take reservations". As I slid into a monumental ball of anger and lost it, yes I really did, lose it on this girl, she finally got the idea I was not joking and got her "manager". Ah yes, to no surprise, and to my chagrin - who was the manager? The woman I booked the reservation through! Since I was about to start peppering this woman with the worst curse words I could think of, my mother and father stepped in and spoke with her. Oh, well our reservation had gotten "lost in the scuffle" of Silverton changing over management styles and who takes reservations for what. WELL THEN - where is my credit card information!? I'd like to know that.

Then the lady says, don't worry we are setting up the table now. Okay. What if there had not been enough room in the buffet to seat our 25 person table, what then? As the lady keep apologizing and we march into the buffet with little servers still scurrying around trying to set up our non-existent reservation I am still hopping mad.

The food is mediocre. There's a pasta bar - woo hoo. There's hardly any selection of varying ethnic cuisines. The only decent section is the dessert bar. On our night there they were making excellent bananas foster. 

They didn't comp us. They only apologized after my father insisted they apologize to us for losing our reservation. They still charged us for drinks even though they ROYALLY FUCKED UP.

Never again. And I suggest no one ever eat here and definitely don't even attempt to make a reservation ANYWHERE at Silverton - they'll lose it - and your CREDIT CARD NUMBER TOO!

I went for lunch for the first time.  They are only open for lunch and dinner with brunch on the weekends.   My friends had vouchers for $10 free food from swiping their player cards.  They were located in the Silverton Casino in Las Vegas.  The decor was nicely done.  The tables and booths were spacious and it was easy to get to your table.

The selection of food was limited, but presented well.  The taste of the food was average.  The desserts were okay with a few sugar-free options.

I would return only with a food voucher.

This was our first time at Seasons, a place that is not at all close to home.  We were here for a group dinner, so we couldn't use the free buffet pass that was good on this night only.  Bummer!!  But because the group was already set up in a back area (where, unlike the rest of the restaurant, was WAY too bright), we were able to dodge the line that snaked almost to the door, like Disney World.  That was almost worth paying full price.  The additional down side, though, was that an 18% tip was added on.  Who the hell tips 18% at a buffet????

I was pleasantly surprised to see so much seafood - shrimp in various disguises, king crab legs, baby mussels, oysters Rockefeller, seafood paella, and then it hit me - Duh!  Friday night is Surf & Turf night here.  Mostly everything was well-presented and pretty good.  Nothing was dried out from sitting too long, and one salmon dish - a whole side of salmon over a tomato and onion melange - was particularly delicious.  The steaks were tender and juicy.  Wine was $5 for as much as you wanted.

All in all, I'd go back again, but I'd make sure to go on a night when I can use a coupon!

After reading reviews I decided to come here and I was totally disappointed. The only reason this place is 2 stars Vs 1 star is the very polite, make your own, pasta chef. All the food was very bland and the prime rib was dry and tasteless. For the price it is a decent bargain but I would rather spend some more money for better quality of food. The only thing that was tasty was a potsticker I had otherwise there was nothing to even discuss.

So first I'd like to start out by saying that we got a free voucher for one person to get in to the buffet because of how much we gambled, we so decided one night to go with no dinner plans. We didn't know the buffet schedule and just happened to show up on a Thursday night which was a seafood night, we thought we were in for a treat. Of course I had to pay to get in because my boyfriend was the one with the free voucher. $30.99. Considering it was seafood night that's pretty decently priced I thought. However when we got in there and looked at the selection, we couldn't believe how SMALL the buffet is. And how SMALL the crab legs were. We grabbed our first (and only round) of food and sat down. I realized I hadn't seen anything to cut the crab legs with and asked my server, who pointed me back the crab legs. I went back, seen nothing, and asked one of the cooks where I could find one. He said my server would bring me one. Great. I told him I was pointed here and he went and got me one. Again, small crab legs, the steak was fatty and over cooked, corn was soggy, just about the only thing we liked was the mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. And other than these items they had pizza, chicken, and fries. What a selection! Also, the desert looked like it had been sitting out for hours and tasted like it too. One thing that really got me down was they didn't have those ice cream machines that typical buffets do. Their selection was awful and basically so was the food. I've never been to a buffet and gotten one plate of food for both dinner and dessert and been so disappointed. Never again.

This buffet is FUN, TASTY, WELL-LAID OUT, HAS A GREAT COLOR SCHEME, ETC! First off, the "Seasons buffet" sign attracts me with it avast array of neon colors! Once I'm in the buffet, lines move fast and I'm seated right away! My family and I have been here a couple of times and each time the variety of food is great! The Italian area has amazing pizzas and pastas, the "American food" section has great potatoes , corn, and fried chicken, and the Mexican food area has great beans, rice, and tacos! The ice cream and pie selection for dessert is amazing! Soft serve is boss! I highly suggest the Seasons buffet at Silverton!

We were in Vegas for CES - staying at the Silverton - joining their gambling club enabled a 10% off + on thursdays you get an additional 2 for 1 deal.  Aside from that - the fare was slightly less varied but of good quality and presentation.  But let's not be fooled into thinking it is spectacular.  I gave 3 stars for being a good deal - and good grub!  Realy it is A-OK!

At the price point, this is a solid locals buffet. It is very comparable in quality and pricing to the Feast Buffets at GVR and Red Rock, which are the feature buffets for the Station Casinos properties. Like you should do at any buffet, it's important to do a full assessment of the food offerings before choosing anything. Once you've analyzed the situation, then you can make well reasoned food choices and pace yourself as necessary. There always ends up being a few items that catch my eyes and allow me to leave full upon completion. A plus is that coupons for 50% off a buffet come regularly in the mail, which make the buffet an especially good deal. Since it's the closest casino to my house and the coupons keep arriving, I'll continue to come.

Moved here 8 months ago and we have eat at all the major Casino Buffets.. Most really are disappointing and expensive.. I finally got to eat here today and the food was just unbelievably good, bordering on Great!, The staff was very friendly, the process was a Bargain and $9.99 with you player card.. 

I love the décor. the hugh aquarium and pleasant table games and dealers.. I really was very impressed with the entire location and the Bass Pro Shop next door. 

I promise you, give it a try.. you will be very surprised how nice it is there..

Wow. I had a buy one get one free from here and I still felt like I wanted my money back. This place is best suited for chainsmoking, walkers with tennis ball,  Ben gay smothered geriatrics. You'd get better food at Sizzler. So, heads up, SKIP IT. If you find yourself at this spot and you HAVE to eat, Go to the cafe. It's much, much better!

Enjoyed the Polynesian themed buffet on Saturday night.  Great food at a great value.  

Poke, roasted pig, banana leaf pork - I was back in Hawaii.  

Not a big fan of the dessert, but didn't mind - I really had no room for it.

Silverton's buffet is definitely a player in the Vegas buffet competition. The decor, like the entire resort, is a natural / outdoors meets indoors. Very pretty. The food was good. We went for lunch. Our buffet was comped because we joined and played in the Silverton Player's Club. The service was good more "help yourself" as opposed to what you'd experience say at the Mirage. However, I did notice the lunch buffet was only around 10.00 as opposed to the mega strip resorts being around 24.00 for lunch. I did not see what dinner cost was.
